* Exhibit 21: List of subsidiaries

The registration statement also includes a table of contents, signatures from the company's executives and directors, and a power of attorney.

Please note that this is just an initial review, and there may be additional information or exhibits not mentioned here.

The lockup period is as follows:

• No shares will be eligible for sale on the date of this prospectus; and
• 180 days after the date of this prospectus.

In mm/dd/yyyy format, the start of the lock-up period would be the same as the date of the prospectus, but since that information is not provided, we cannot determine the exact start date. However, we can identify the end of the lockup period:

• Upon expiration of the lock-up agreements and market stand-off provisions described below, following the date that is 180 days after the date of this prospectus.

Let's assume the date of the prospectus is January 1, 2023. Then, the end of the lockup period would be:

06/29/2023

According to the document, the lock-up period is 180 days after the date of this prospectus. The date can be represented in mm/dd/yyyy format as:

06/30/yyyy (assuming the year is not specified)

Please note that the year is not mentioned in the document, so I've left it blank.

According to the document, the lockup period is 180 days after the date of this prospectus. Therefore, the lockup period is:

06/17/yyyy (mm/dd/yyyy format)

According to the document, the lock-up period starts on the date of this prospectus and ends 180 days after the date of this prospectus.

Here is the exact text that specifies the start and end dates:

"...following the date that is 180 days after the date of this prospectus."

In mm/dd/yyyy format, the start date would be the same as the date of the prospectus (which is not specified in the document), and the end date would be:

06/30/yyyy

(assuming the year is omitted by mistake)

The lockup period is stated as follows:

• No shares will be eligible for sale on the date of this prospectus.
• Shares will be eligible for sale upon expiration of the lock-up agreements and market stand-off provisions described below, following the date that is 180 days after the date of this prospectus.

So, the lockup period starts from the date of this prospectus (no specific date mentioned) and ends 180 days later.

The lock-up period is 180 days after the date of this prospectus. In mm/dd/yyyy format, that would be:

06/30/yyyy (assuming today's date)

Please note that the year part (yyyy) is not specified in the document, so you'll need to fill it in with the actual year.
